data.title: An in-depth review of Hevo Data
data.description: Hevo Data’s solutions help data teams not only streamline but also automate data flows across their organization. Hevo’s approach to data pipelines and ETL can result in hours of engineering time per week being saved, quicker reporting and analytics, and better data-driven decision-making. Hevo Data is an end-to-end, bi-directional, no-code data pipeline platform specifically designed for ELT, ETL and Reverse ETL projects. It enables data teams to pull data from all their data sources into warehouses, execute transformations for analytics and provide operational intelligence to business tools. Hevo users don’t need custom configurations in place, as Hevo’s data flow is codeless and automated out-of-the-box. It’s designed to simplify the way users manage future changes like the addition of new tables and columns and changing data types. Setting up a data pipeline with Hevo’s codeless approach takes just a handful of minutes. Hevo delivers a multi-tenant platform that leverages multiple components of the AWS cloud for its infrastructure. It’s tailored to process billions of records, and depending on business needs, Hevo is capable of automatically scaling up or down. Hevo also optimizes users’ returns on investment, since its architecture ensures that system resource utilization is constantly optimized. The platform offers an intuitive user interface that does away with the need for technical resources for setting up and managing customer data pipelines. It also streamlines analytics tasks through well-integrated data transformation features. Hevo supports more than 150 ready-to-use integrations for databases, cloud storage, streaming services and SDKs. Redshift and MySQL are popular databases that are compatible, while data warehouses such as BigQuery and Snowflake are also supported.

data.title: Top 7 Trello alternatives for project management
data.description: Trello was one of the early project management tools that helped kanban-style workflows become mainstream for almost any type of business. Trello has continued to improve since its launch in 2011 with added features like dashboards, timelines and tables. It has also completely revamped its card system, which allows for connecting across different boards and even apps. In that same time, more project management alternatives have entered the marketplace, and many have exciting features that match Trello’s latest offerings. If your team’s requirements have surpassed Trello’s features, or if you’re just researching whether there may be a project management tool that is a better fit for your organization, check out how the top Trello alternatives compare to Trello’s features set..Trello’s main strength is its simplicity and easy learning curve; teams and individuals can quickly add new boards and cards without menu-diving or other navigation hassles. However, some users may have outgrown Trello and need features that can handle more complex projects and workflows.

data.title: Recent 2022 cyberattacks presage a rocky 2023
data.description: Ceri Shaw, chief delivery officer at CodeClan, an SQA accredited digital skills academy, said that Twitter users who notice suspicious activity — such as password reset emails, unusual pop-ups on their device and targeted phishing emails — should review security settings and regularly update their passwords to include special characters, letters and numbers with no relevance to personal information. Given Elon Musk’s lackadaisical attitude toward regulation and his recent firing frenzy at Twitter, a breach of this severity was inevitable,” he said. “Urgent questions must now be asked of Twitter’s data protection capabilities, as the site’s popularity makes it a prime target for hackers. EmiSoft’s yearly State of Ransomware in the US report detailed that last year, 106 local governments, 44 colleges and universities, 45 school districts and 25 healthcare providers were attacked for ransom. In the latter sector, the group said the most significant incident of the year was on CommonSpirit Health, which operates almost 150 hospitals. EmiSoft’s yearly State of Ransomware in the US report detailed that last year, 106 local governments, 44 colleges and universities, 45 school districts and 25 healthcare providers were attacked for ransom. In the latter sector, the group said the most significant incident of the year was on CommonSpirit Health, which operates almost 150 hospitals. EmiSoft’s yearly State of Ransomware in the US report detailed that last year, 106 local governments, 44 colleges and universities, 45 school districts and 25 healthcare providers were attacked for ransom. In the latter sector, the group said the most significant incident of the year was on CommonSpirit Health, which operates almost 150 hospitals. The report also noted that the number of ransomware attacks on U.S. state and local governments has remained fairly flat since 2019, when the firm recorded 113 attacks, and 2022, when it recorded 106 attacks. The same is true for education, with the number of yearly attacks between 2019 and 2022 remaining in the high 80s.

data.title: How to deploy Apache Tomcat on Ubuntu Server
data.description: Apache Tomcat has been around for a while and is still one of the more popular app server and servlet containers available. This is an open source implementation of several technologies from the Jarkarta EE platform and is free to use by anyone. Apache Tomcat features session replication, clustering, and JMX-based server monitoring and control. If you’re looking for a Java app server, Apache Tomcat is what you want.
